snp1.1:2.3: In SN 35.241, the “near shore” is the six interior senses and the “far shore” is the six exterior senses.
snp1.1:7.1: The commentary interprets vitakka as “wrong thoughts”, but the identical line at Ud 6.7:4.1 clearly refers to jhāna. The commentary also reads vidhūpitā as “burning up”, but vidhūpa refers to clearing the mist, smoke, or incense.
snp1.1:9.2: Bodhi, Norman, and Ṭhānissaro all render vitatha as “unreal”. This seems overly idealistic for early Buddhism, so I take the prefix vi in the sense of “distorts”, “twists”.
